content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Find all code blocks in markdown
    blocks = matchall(r"```julia\n(.*?)```", md, 1)
    
    # Remove code fences from each block
    cleaned_blocks = [replace(b, "`" => "") for b in blocks]
    
    # Join the cleaned blocks with a newline
    joined_code = join([b for b in cleaned_blocks], "\n")
    
    return joined_code
end
```

This function uses regular expressions to find all code blocks in `md`, then removes the fences from each block. Finally, it joins the cleaned blocks with a newline and returns the result. Note that this assumes that all code blocks are of the "julia" language. If you have other types of code blocks, you'll need to modify the regular expression accordingly.
